alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Grundy; Kane; Kendall; La Salle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 10:05PM CST until February 18 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Kendall County in northeastern Illinois... La Salle County in north central Illinois... Southeastern De Kalb County in north central Illinois... Grundy County in northeastern Illinois... Southeastern Kane County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 1100 PM CST. * At 1005 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Montgomery to near Sheridan to near Princeton, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 41 and 72. I-55 between mile markers 226 and 234. I-80 between mile markers 74 and 122. I-88 between mile markers 118 and 119. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Joliet, Plainfield, Oswego, Ottawa, Yorkville, Streator, Morris, Channahon, Minooka, Plano, Peru, La Salle, Sandwich, Mendota, Braidwood, Coal City, Marseilles, Sheridan and Montgomery. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Serious injuries and deaths may result from people exiting their vehicles during a snow squall. Drivers may not be able to see you or to stop! If stopped on the roadway or involved in an accident, quickly exit your vehicle move as far away from the roadway as possible ONLY when it is safe to do so. Do not stand along or near the roadway, since approaching vehicles may be unable to maintain control.

area.areaDesc: De Kalb; Grundy; Kane; Kendall; La Salle
